column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=Zinc oxide has been applied in many fields ; including gas sensors , photodiodes , lithium-ion batteries and particularly solar cells .
#Text=ZnO can be easily fabricated into various morphologies ( e.g. , nanowires , nanorods , nanotubes , nanoflowers , nanosheets ) on different substrates .
#Text=Therefore , ZnO in different shapes and in composites is studied for various applications .
#Text=Recently , some authors combined ZnO in heterostructure with CdS and studied its photocatalytic properties .

#Text=ZnO in the form of thin film with CdS nanoparticles on the surface has been shown to be a high-performance material for photocatalytic degradation of methylene blue , while ZnO/CdS hierarchical composites have shown great photocatalytic H2-production performance .

#Text=Wu et al. prepared ZnO hollow spheres and the hedgehog-like ZnO hollow spheres and studied their use as anodes for lithium-ion batteries , having good rate capacity , cycling performance , and high initial specific capacity .
#Text=ZnO nanowires have prominent electron transport properties , which are beneficial for solar cell application .
#Text=However , ZnO is not chemically stable and is prone to dissolution .
#Text=One way to avoid this fact is to coat a chemically stable shell on ZnO nanowires .

#Text=On the other hand , nanostructured titanium dioxide is known as a material with notable physical and chemical properties , such as high photo-activity and environmental stability , as well as low cost synthesis .

#Text=TiO2 exists in nature in three different crystalline phases : anatase , rutile , and brookite , but it was found that anatase ( band gap ~3.2 eV ) is more photo-active than other modifications .

#Text=It is widely used for photovoltaic applications , primarily as an electron transport layer ( ETL ) in perovskite and dye sensitized solar cells , due to a suitable band gap for the acceptance of electrons from the active layer of solar cells .

#Text=The studies aimed to improve the optical and transport properties of TiO2-based electron conduction layers , which are of considerable importance for the enhancement of photovoltaic performance .

#Text=By a combination of the high reactivity of TiO2 and the large binding energy of ZnO , the process of electron transfer between the corresponding conduction and valence bands can be facilitated in the composite system .

#Text=In comparison to mesoporous thin films on transparent conductive oxide ( TCO ) operated as ETL in solar cells , 1-dimensional ( 1D ) nanostructures on TCO substrates can provide a direct pathway for electron transport and offer open channels for filling with light absorbers and HTMs for solar cells .
#Text=Moreover , oriented nanorod-like materials on TCO are known for their efficient charge separation and transport properties and are thus favorable for achieving good device performance .
#Text=Therefore , growth of oriented nanorods ( NRs ) on TCO substrates has drawn extensive research interest in solar energy utilization in the past years .

#Text=Moreover , the utilization of the single-crystalline 1D nanostructures with preferred orientation for ETL decreases the number of grain boundaries that decrease conductivity , as was observed in studies on ZnO nanostructure .
#Text=Thus , Wu et al. investigated rapidly synthesized ZnO nanowires for photodetector application and produced nanowires which consist of nanoparticles .
#Text=They concluded that these nanowires have adsorption sites on the inter-granular surface , which can lead to the increased reactivity of these surfaces and , therefore , a low conductivity .

#Text=Their finding is in accordance with old paper of Oktik where he stated that a large density of extrinsic electron traps , present at the grain boundaries due to oxygen chemisorption , results in a barrier to charge-carrier conduction at grain boundaries .

#Text=Annealing in vacuum or in reducing atmosphere desorbs the oxygen and therefore decreases the grain boundary potential barrier and increases the effective charge-carrier concentration ( and therefore the conductivity ) .
#Text=Natsume and Sakata prepared ZnO films by sol – gel spin-coating and confirmed the grain boundary scattering effect due to thermionic emission .
